FDG.function_description: Habit tracking & daily planning with cute UI

core_logic.logic: The user can interact with two elements on the main page: clicking the top - left checkmark button or the close challenge card button. These are two separate click actions available on the initial page of the habit - tracking app.

steps.summary: Click the top left checkmark button
Click the close challenge card button

FDG.function_description: This page functions as the side menu (via hamburger menu) for the "MyDiary" app, providing options for sales, theme customization, tags, diary security, backup/restore, export/import, donations, app sharing, social following, more apps, help, and settings.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0. The user clicks the hamburger menu button (S1), which opens the side menu (page 1) containing various options like sales, theme, tags, and more. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops as it's just the initial opening of the side menu.

steps.summary: Click the hamburger menu button to open the side menu

FDG.function_description: The page offers a new user sale with 50% off, presenting monthly, annual, and permanent subscription options, a limited - time countdown, and a button to start a free trial, while also providing terms, privacy policy, and restore options.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0. The user clicks the gift icon button (on page 0) to navigate to page 2, which displays the new user sale with subscription options, a countdown, and a free trial button, along with terms, privacy policy, and restore options. There are no branches or loops here as it's a single navigation step to the sale page.

steps.summary: Click the gift icon button on page 0 to navigate to the new user sale page (page 2).

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a search functionality to look up entries within the diaries section of the habit tracking and daily planning app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main diary page (page 0) and clicks the search icon to navigate to the search page (page 3). On the search page, the user inputs a search term (e.g., 'summer vacation') into the diary search field. Optionally, the user can click the back arrow to return to the main diary page.

steps.summary: Click search icon to open diary search page
Input search term into diary search field
Click back arrow to return to main diary page

FDG.function_description: The current page (accessed via the three - dot menu from the habit tracking and daily planning page) provides options for backing up data and sorting items within the habit tracking and daily planning application.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the habit tracking and daily planning page. The user clicks the three - dot menu button, which opens a menu with options for backing up data and sorting items. At this point, the user can choose between the 'Backup' or 'Sort by' options (though only the menu opening step is provided here).

steps.summary: Click the three - dot menu button to open the menu with backup and sort options

FDG.function_description: Displays details of the "Morning Yoga" habit for December 30, 2025, with options to navigate to previous/next days, edit, or access additional settings, and prompts to upgrade to Pro to remove ads.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0. First, the user clicks the cute emoji on the date card (action [0,6]) to navigate to the detailed habit page (page 5). On the detailed page, the user can either click the back arrow to return to the entry page (action [5,0]) or click the next date button to stay on the same page (action [5,4]) to view the next day’s habit details.

steps.summary: Click cute emoji on date card to open detailed habit page
Click back arrow to return to entry page
Click next date button to view next day’s habit details

FDG.function_description: The Calendar page in the habit tracking and daily planning app displays a monthly calendar view for December 2025, highlights the current date (December 30, 2025) with a timestamp, and provides a button to add new entries or events for habit tracking or daily planning.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0, where the Calendar tab button is clicked to navigate to the Calendar page (page 6). On the Calendar page, the user can select a date (e.g., 1 Dec 2025), interact with the month/year dropdown, or return to the previous page. The main flow is linear with optional interactions (date selection, dropdown, back) that don’t branch the core navigation.

steps.summary: Navigate to Calendar page
Return to previous page
Select date (1 Dec 2025)
Interact with month/year dropdown

FDG.function_description: This page functions as a daily journal entry interface for a habit - tracking and daily - planning app, enabling users to input a title and respond to prompts about the day's weather, activities, and feelings, with the option to save the entry.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 0 and clicks the add button to enter the journal entry page (page 7). On page 7, the user inputs a title for the journal entry. Then, the user can either click the SAVE button to save the entry (navigating to page 5) or click the neutral face emoji to select a mood (remaining on page 7 for now).

steps.summary: Click add task/habit button to open journal entry page
Input title for journal entry
Click SAVE button to save journal entry
Click neutral face emoji to select mood

FDG.function_description: The "Mine" (Profile) page in the habit tracking and daily planning app allows users to sign in, access a new user sale for unlocking features, track progress in a 3 - day habit challenge, view diary - related streaks, get diary writing assistance with templates, and check mood statistics over the last 30 days.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0, where the user clicks the Profile tab button (action_ref [0,9]) to navigate to the Profile page (page 8). From the Profile page, the user can click the back arrow (action_ref [8,0]) to return to page 0. There are no branches or loops as the actions are a simple navigation to and from the Profile page.

steps.summary: Click Profile tab button to go to Profile page
Click back navigation arrow to return to previous page

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a theme selection interface for the diary app, allowing users to browse and apply different visual themes (categorized as HOT, DARK, LIGHT) to customize the app's appearance.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 and clicks the 'Theme' menu option to navigate to the theme selection page (page 9). Then, on page 9, the user clicks the 'APPLY' button for the cozy cat theme to apply it, completing the theme customization process.

steps.summary: Click 'Theme' menu option to open theme selection page
Click 'APPLY' button for cozy cat theme to apply it

FDG.function_description: Close sale popup button

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the page with the New User Sale popup (page 2). The user clicks the close sale popup button (at position [1016, 144]), which navigates to the destination page (page 11), effectively closing the popup.

steps.summary: Click the close sale popup button

FDG.function_description: Monthly subscription plan card

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 2. The user clicks the Monthly subscription plan card, which navigates to page 12. There are no branches or loops as this is a single action to access the monthly plan's details or purchase flow.

steps.summary: Click the Monthly subscription plan card

FDG.function_description: Permanent subscription plan card

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 2 (New User Sale screen). The user clicks the Permanent subscription plan card, which navigates to page 13. There are no branches or loops as this is a single action flow.

steps.summary: Click the Permanent subscription plan card

FDG.function_description: Displays a network error message prompting the user to check their connection and try again, with an "OK" button to dismiss the error, while the underlying page offers new user subscription options with a 50% discount.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the new user subscription page (50% discount). The user clicks the 'Start Free Trial' button, which triggers a network error popup. Then, the user clicks the 'OK' button in the error popup to dismiss it, returning to the underlying subscription page.

steps.summary: Click 'Start Free Trial' button on the new user subscription page
Click 'OK' button in the network error popup

FDG.function_description: The current page (New User Sale popup) promotes a free trial for a subscription service, highlighting benefits like a 3 - day free trial, access to all Pro features, and the ability to cancel anytime, with a "TRY FOR FREE" button to start the trial.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the New User Sale page (page 2). The user clicks the 'Terms of Service' link (though the main trial flow likely involves the 'TRY FOR FREE' button, here we process the given action). This click navigates to page 15, completing the action's flow.

steps.summary: Click the Terms of Service link

FDG.function_description: The current page is the home screen of the mobile device, displaying the "My Diary" app icon along with other app icons (Messages, Chrome) at the bottom, allowing users to access installed applications.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the home screen (page 2) with the 'My Diary' app icon. The user performs a click action on the 'Privacy Policy' link (at position [523, 2328]), which navigates to the destination page (page 16). There are no branches or loops in this logic as it is a single, linear navigation step.

steps.summary: Click the 'Privacy Policy' link on the home screen

FDG.function_description: The page offers a New User Sale with 50% off on subscription plans (Monthly, Annual, Permanent) for a habit tracking/daily planning app, includes a free trial option, and provides a "Restore" link to recover previous purchases.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the New User Sale page (page 2). The user can click the 'Restore Purchases' link (action at S1), which remains on the same page (page 2) after the click. There are no branches or loops as only one action is present.

steps.summary: Click the 'Restore Purchases' link

FDG.function_description: Eye icon (visibility toggle)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 5. The user clicks the eye icon (visibility toggle) on page 5, which navigates to page 19. There are no branches or loops as this is a single action with a direct navigation.

steps.summary: Click the eye icon (visibility toggle) on page 5

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to edit and input details (such as weather, activities, feelings, and a title) for the date 30 December 2025, with options to save the entered information and use various formatting/input tools.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the page for 30 December 2025. They click the pencil (edit) icon to enter the editing mode, which opens the page with input fields for title, weather, activities, feelings, and formatting tools, along with a 'SAVE' button. No branches or loops are present in this initial flow as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click the pencil (edit) icon to enter the editing page for 30 Dec 2025.

FDG.function_description: The current page's three - dot menu provides options like deleting the date - related entry, pinning it to the top, sharing it, exporting it as a PDF, accessing more export options, and also shows the character and word count for the date - related content (which is zero in this case) for the 30th December 2025 date detail page.

core_logic.logic: On the 30th December 2025 date detail page, the user clicks the three - dot menu button. This action opens a menu that displays options such as deleting the entry, pinning it to the top, sharing it, exporting as a PDF, accessing more export options, and also shows the character and word count (both zero in this case).

steps.summary: Click the three - dot menu button on the 30th December 2025 date detail page

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a user profile interface that prompts users to log in (via the "Tap to login" option) and displays placeholder fields for username, bio, and account status (indicating no bio or account is set up yet).

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the 'Mine' page (page 8). First, the user clicks the 'Sign in' button (action [8,1]) to navigate to the 'My Profile' page (page 22). On the 'My Profile' page, the user can choose to input a username (action [22,1]) or input a bio (action [22,2]), with these being mutually exclusive initial input choices after reaching the profile page.

steps.summary: Click 'Sign in' button to go to My Profile page
Input username in the username field
Input bio in the bio field

FDG.function_description: The page offers a "New User Sale" with 50% off, presenting monthly, annual, and permanent subscription options, a countdown timer, and a "Start Free Trial" button to upgrade the habit - tracking and daily - planning app's features.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the 'Mine' page. The user clicks the 'UPGRADE' button in the 'New User Sale' section, which navigates to the 'New User Sale' page displaying subscription options, a countdown timer, and a 'Start Free Trial' button for upgrading app features.

steps.summary: Click the UPGRADE button in the New User Sale section

FDG.function_description: The current page is a share menu that allows the user to share the diary card from the profile page via various apps and services such as Gmail, My Diary, Messages, Google Photos, Drive, Hangouts, Add to Maps, and Search image.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the profile page (page 8). They click the share icon on the diary card, which opens the share menu (page 23) with various sharing options like Gmail, My Diary, etc. This is a single step to trigger the share menu display.

steps.summary: Click the share icon on the diary card to open the share menu.

FDG.function_description: The page provides various diary templates (Quick Guide, Gratitude Diary, Self - Care Diary, Learning Diary) and an option to create a custom template, allowing users to start different types of diary - keeping activities for daily planning and self - reflection.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 8 (Mine page) and clicks the 'START' button related to diary templates. This action navigates to page 24 (Templates page), where various diary templates (Quick Guide, Gratitude Diary, Self - Care Diary, Learning Diary) and a custom template option are available for the user to choose from to start a diary - keeping activity.

steps.summary: Click the 'START' button (diary templates) on page 8 to navigate to the Templates page (page 24).

FDG.function_description: The Settings page in the habit tracking and daily planning app allows users to configure various app preferences, including general settings (e.g., mood style, sticker mall, tags, diary lock, backup/restore, theme, notification, export/import) and diary preferences (e.g., default mood, mood display on calendar, image time application).

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the 'Mine' page. The user clicks the Settings gear icon, which navigates to the Settings page where various app preferences (general and diary-related) can be configured. There are no branches or loops in this initial flow as it’s a single navigation step to access the settings.

steps.summary: Click the Settings gear icon on the 'Mine' page to navigate to the Settings page.

FDG.function_description: Close popup icon

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 15 where a popup is visible. The user clicks the close popup icon (X) located at the specified position. This action closes the popup and navigates to page 18, completing the task of dismissing the popup.

steps.summary: Click the close popup icon (X) to dismiss the popup and navigate to the next page.

FDG.function_description: Displays a network error message to the user, prompting them to check their connection and try again, with an “OK” button to dismiss the error dialog.

The current page functions as a user profile login and editing interface, allowing users to initiate the login process by tapping the avatar, and also displaying or editing username, bio, and account information.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the My Profile page. The core action is tapping the 'Tap to login' avatar button, which likely initiates the login process. Since there's only one action provided, the flow is a single step focused on this login initiation.

steps.summary: Tap the 'Tap to login' avatar button to initiate login

FDG.function_description: This page promotes a new user sale with a 50% discount, offering monthly, annual, and permanent subscription plans, along with a countdown timer and a "Start Free Trial" button for the annual plan.
data_out: new template creation initiation (with subscription prompt)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Templates page (page 24). The user clicks the 'Create My Template' button, which navigates to the New User Sale page (page 2) displaying subscription plans, a countdown timer, and a 'Start Free Trial' button for the annual plan. There are no branches or loops as it’s a single navigation step.

steps.summary: Click 'Create My Template' button to navigate to the New User Sale page.

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a diary entry interface where users can input a title and respond to guided prompts (weather, daily activities, feelings) for a specific date (30 Dec 2025), with options to save the entry and use formatting/attachment tools.

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the 'START (Quick Guide)' button on the Templates page, which navigates to the diary entry interface for 30 Dec 2025. Here, the user can input a title and respond to guided prompts (weather, daily activities, feelings), then use formatting/attachment tools and save the entry.

steps.summary: Click 'START (Quick Guide)' button to enter diary entry page

FDG.function_description: The Mood Style page in the diary app allows users to select and customize their mood representation style, offering options like Normal Mood and various PRO Mood styles (Cat, Chick, Soul) with distinct emoji or character - based mood icons.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Settings page. First, the user clicks the Mood Style setting to navigate to the Mood Style page. Then, the user clicks the Normal Mood neutral face emoji to select this mood style, completing the customization.

steps.summary: Click Mood Style setting to navigate to Mood Style page
Click Normal Mood neutral face emoji to select this mood style

FDG.function_description: Display Mood on Calendar toggle
data_out: display mood on calendar setting (state changed)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Settings page (page 25). They perform a click action on the 'Display Mood on Calendar' toggle, which transitions the app to page 29. This action toggles the setting for displaying moods from diaries on the calendar.

steps.summary: Click the 'Display Mood on Calendar' toggle

FDG.function_description: PRO Mood - Cat enable toggle

core_logic.logic: On the Mood Style page, the user clicks the checkbox next to 'PRO Mood - Cat' to enable this mood style. This action directly toggles the state of the PRO Mood - Cat option, completing the functional point's execution.

steps.summary: Click the checkbox for PRO Mood - Cat to enable it

FDG.function_description: PRO Mood - Cat gray cat emoji
data_in: PRO Mood - Cat mood style option
data_out: PRO Mood - Cat mood style setting enabled

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 28 (Mood Style). The user clicks on the gray cat emoji under the 'PRO Mood - Cat' section, which leads to page 32. This is a single-step action with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click the gray cat emoji in PRO Mood - Cat section
